---
title: "date.ts"
---

## High-level description
This code defines a utility function `makePeriod` for creating FHIR Period objects with random or specified start and end dates. It's primarily used for testing purposes, generating mock data for FHIR-related functionality.

## Symbols

### `makePeriod`
#### Description
The `makePeriod` function creates a FHIR Period object with random or specified start and end dates. It uses the Faker library to generate random dates when not provided.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| param | Partial&lt;Period&gt; | Optional. Partial Period object to override default values. |

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| Period | Period | A FHIR Period object with start and end dates. |

#### Internal Logic
1. Generate a random end date using `faker.date.past()`.
2. Generate a random start date using `faker.date.past()`, ensuring it's before the end date.
3. Create and return a Period object, using provided values from `param` if available, otherwise using the generated dates.
4. Convert dates to ISO string format.

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| @faker-js/faker | Used to generate random dates for the Period object. |
| @medplum/fhirtypes | Provides the Period type definition from FHIR. |

## Performance Considerations
The function uses random date generation, which may have slight performance implications if called frequently. However, as this is likely used for testing purposes, performance is not a critical concern.
